msgSnippet: You can do a number of different tests. Check the size of the error log before and after you write to it and compare the values. Open the log file after you

From: "Van Dooren, Damian" <VanDoorenD@...>

You can do a number of different tests.

Check the size of the error log before and after you write to it and compare
the values.

Open the log file after you have written to it and determine if the last
line is what you were expecting. (to make this easier, clear out the file
before you log to it in the unit test code).



-----Original Message-----
From: Bhavaniprasad Polimetla
[mailto:bhavaniprasad.polimetla@...]
Sent: Monday, May 21, 2001 7:25 AM
To: junit
Subject: [junit] testing flat file data


Dear sir,

I am testing "log" function.
It will write the data into predefined flat file. It wont return any
values.
Ex:
_errLog.log("testing error log.log");

How can I write the test?

Regards,
Bhavani.
